Package com.example.carturestibackend.services

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.example.carturestibackend.services.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
Service class to handle business logic related to users.

  • Method Details

    • findUsers

      public List<UserDTO> findUsers()
      Retrieves all users from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of UserDTO objects representing the users.

    • findUserById

      public UserDTO findUserById(long id_user)
      Retrieves a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id_user - The ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The UserDTO object representing the retrieved user.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.data.rest.webmvc.ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the specified ID is not found.

    • findUserByName

      Retrieves a user by their name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The UserDTO object representing the retrieved user.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.data.rest.webmvc.ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the specified name is not found.

    • findUserByEmail

      public UserDTO findUserByEmail(String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The UserDTO object representing the retrieved user.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.data.rest.webmvc.ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the specified email is not found.

    • insert

      public long insert(UserDTO userDTO)
      Inserts a new user into the database.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - The UserDTO object representing the user to insert.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly inserted user.

    • deleteUserById

      public void deleteUserById(long id_user)
      Deletes a user from the database by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id_user - The ID of the user to delete.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.data.rest.webmvc.ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the specified ID is not found.

    • updateUser

      public UserDTO updateUser(long id_user, UserDTO userDTO)
      Updates an existing user in the database.
      Parameters:
      id_user - The ID of the user to update.
      userDTO - The updated UserDTO object representing the new state of the user.
      Returns:
      The updated UserDTO object.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.data.rest.webmvc.ResourceNotFoundException - if the user with the specified ID is not found.
